*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Brazoria, July 19, 1832, All must now unite in support of Santa Anna and the Liberals. Bradburn precipitated the clash in Texas. Williams must not take to heart popular disapproval of his pacific policy.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*person_mentioned*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Library, Galveston, Tex.]*/person_mentioned*
*p**location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="07-19-1832">July 19 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir,*/p*
*p*I had not time to say much by *person_mentioned*Wm. Austin*/person_mentioned*. Since he left I have heard of the excitement which some have felt against you owing to the difference of opinion as to what ought to be done in the critical situation of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. These [are] things to be expected everywhere and amongst all people under excitement—they have their hour and pass away and are forgotten. All that is necessary for you to do or say is, that you wished to do for the best—may have been mistaken as to the means, that nothing but an anxious desire to serve the common cause of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*actuated you, without personal feelings against anyone, that in your moments of excitement you blamed others who differed in opinion with you, and that they also had the same right to blame you, for both thought their course the best etc. Something of this nature and in a good [hu]mored way, without any display of passion or irritation against anyone will soon put it all at rest—some of the *person_mentioned*leading men in the *location_mentioned*U. S*/location_mentioned*.*/person_mentioned* have had the honor of being stuck up in effigy for political opinions, so that you need not feel mortified at that. A few persons here last night had you and two others *person_mentioned*Chambers */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Lewis */person_mentioned*up in effigy—it will do you no harm unless you get into a passion about it—so keep quite cool and let it all pass away, as it will do of itself. The fact is that the state of things has been such that, at times none of us knew or could tell what course was the best—all had but one object in view which was to do right as near as they could—en fin, vale mas reir qe maldecir.*/p*
*p*The *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*and all *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*have but one course left which is to unite in the cause of the *person_mentioned*Santana party*/person_mentioned*, and if necessary fight it out with the *person_mentioned*ministerialists*/person_mentioned*— I have written to *person_mentioned*Musquis */person_mentioned*urging him to make a pronunciamto in *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned*. *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*will follow as a matter of course and *person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*will acquiess or have to leave the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*for *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have great need here for*person_mentioned* Mr. Greaves */person_mentioned*and hope he will come down—tho it is now almost too late. I wish the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamto */person_mentioned*to make a formal pronunciamto as soon as possible and advise the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*to call an extra meeting as soon as possible so as to give time for the *person_mentioned*members */person_mentioned*to attend, this is very important indeed. We must now all pull at the same end of the rope.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Teran */person_mentioned*killed himself at *location_mentioned*Padilla */location_mentioned*on the *date_mentioned n="07-03-1832">3*/date_mentioned*—he ran his sword through his heart on the*location_mentioned* very spot where *person_mentioned*Iturbide */person_mentioned*was shot*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Montezuma*/person_mentioned* left *location_mentioned*Tampico */location_mentioned*for *location_mentioned*San Luis*/location_mentioned* with 1500 *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*soon after *person_mentioned*Mexia */person_mentioned*sailed for *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*—it was a combined movement, ordered by *person_mentioned*Montezuma*/person_mentioned*, to [enable] *person_mentioned*Mexia */person_mentioned*to take *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned*by keeping *person_mentioned*Teran */person_mentioned* employed elsewhere—*person_mentioned*commissioners */person_mentioned*are appointed by *person_mentioned*Santana */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Bustamte */person_mentioned*to meet at the *location_mentioned*Puerto Nacional*/location_mentioned* to settle the question, *person_mentioned*Victoria */person_mentioned*by *person_mentioned*Santana*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Camacho */person_mentioned*by *person_mentioned*Bustamte */person_mentioned*and I think it probable the whole matter is settled by this time.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mexia */person_mentioned*and myself have been enthusiastically recd, here—it was a joyfull event for the whole *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, for I think it [will] unite *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*on the same side, and right or wrong we must all pull together. I intended to have started up *date_mentioned n="07-20-1832">tomorrow */date_mentioned*and if necessary gone from there with *person_mentioned*volunteers */person_mentioned*against *location_mentioned*Anahuac */location_mentioned*by the *person_mentioned*time Mexia */person_mentioned*got round with the fleet—but*date_mentioned n="07-21-1832"> day after tomorrow */date_mentioned*is a grand Ball, and we must stay. I think it will be unnecessary for any men to go to *location_mentioned*Anahuac*/location_mentioned* for the *person_mentioned*troops */person_mentioned*there will no doubt pronounce.*/p*
*p*Don't let these matters worry you, what you have done was for the best. Under the circumstances in which you were placed it was impossible to say what was for the best-—all reasonable *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned* will look at the motives and not at hasty expressions made in a moment of great excitement. I will write to the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*to call a meeting of the *person_mentioned*ayto*/person_mentioned*.—it must be as soon as possible for I wish to return with *person_mentioned*Mexia */person_mentioned*to *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned*so as to be at *location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*by the *date_mentioned n="09-01-1832">1 of September.*/date_mentioned* He will stay no longer at *location_mentioned*Galveston */location_mentioned*than is necessary to regulate them at *location_mentioned*Anahuac */location_mentioned*and take *person_mentioned*Bradburn */person_mentioned*where he will probably never more hear of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. His cup of disgrace and infamy is full, up and over the brim.*/p*
*p*Farewell—remember me to *person_mentioned*Sarah */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Mr. Greaves*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Muchissimas memorias a *person_mentioned*Arciniega */person_mentioned*digale que escribi a *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*pa que se pronuncian por *person_mentioned*Santana*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*A*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**date_mentioned n="07-20-1832">20th.*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*I have this moment recd, yours by *person_mentioned*William Austin*/person_mentioned*. I am fully aware of the motives which influenced you.*/p*
*p*I have always expressed to you, both verbally and in writing a wish that the *person_mentioned*colonists */person_mentioned*should not take part in the civil wars of the *person_mentioned*Mexicans*/person_mentioned*, unless they should unfortunately reach *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, in that event there would of course be no remidy left but to take a hand.*/p*
*p*I had no right or reason to expect that that most consummate of all fools, *person_mentioned*Bradburn*/person_mentioned*, would have acted as he has done—he promised and assured me at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Lynche*/person_mentioned*s */location_mentioned*that he would respect the *person_mentioned*civil Authority */person_mentioned*at *location_mentioned*Anahuac */location_mentioned*and concilliate the people there, and I believed he would— he was too much of a *person_mentioned*jack ass*/person_mentioned* to be governed by reason or judgement, or anything else except brutal passion—I therefore could not foresee what has happened, and could not give you instructions in time— what I feared if the *person_mentioned*colonists */person_mentioned*took part in the civil wars was they would get into anarchy and confusion—but will come right now and we shall all pull heart and hand at one end of the rope. See *person_mentioned*Chrisman */person_mentioned*and have the *person_mentioned*Ayto*/person_mentioned*. convened by *date_mentioned n="07-25-1832">Wednesday */date_mentioned*or *date_mentioned n="07-26-1832">thursday */date_mentioned*at most—remember me to *person_mentioned*Mr. Greaves*/person_mentioned*. I shall need his aid in the *person_mentioned*Spanish */person_mentioned*line of business as soon as I get up. Speak to him on the subject. I refer you to *person_mentioned*Johnson */person_mentioned*for particulars as [to] our arrival here etc. I wrote from the *location_mentioned*mouth of the river*/location_mentioned* the moment I landed and *person_mentioned*Cap John Austin*/person_mentioned* directed a copy to be sent up, when he started down to meet us, which was done, but it went *location_mentioned*up the river on the other side*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col Mexia */person_mentioned*would go up with great pleasure, but his fleet is anchored off and he is limited as to time,-he starts on *date_mentioned n="07-23-1832">Monday */date_mentioned*to embark for *location_mentioned*Galveston Bay,*/location_mentioned* and will only be two days at *location_mentioned*Anahuac*/location_mentioned*, as he last night recd, official information of the pronunciamto of that place under *person_mentioned*Col Suveran.*/person_mentioned* The report you speak of, that there had been a saqueo etc is all false. *person_mentioned*Suveran */person_mentioned*has written to *person_mentioned*Cap J. Austin*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Lieut. Domingues*/person_mentioned* is here direct from *location_mentioned*Anahuac*/location_mentioned*— all goes well over there and *person_mentioned*Bradburn */person_mentioned*has taken to the brush. If *person_mentioned*Piedras*/person_mentioned* refuses, we must and will fight him. All *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*must go together. I will write to him from *location_mentioned*San felipe*/location_mentioned* and to *location_mentioned*Ayish bayou*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S F A*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*write to *location_mentioned*Gonzales */location_mentioned*and let them know what they ought to do— La constitución y *person_mentioned*Santana*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
